post_text:
I met with online safety advocates, including Bridgette Norring—who lost her son Devin to fentanyl bought on social media—and Joseph Gordon-Levitt, to discuss repealing Section 230. 
 
Current law shields platforms from responsibility for harms like drug sales to  kids online.

replies.text: Section 230 absolves Facebook, Shitter, etc, from responsibility when their users post dangerous shit. Thusly, they have no incentive to police their users effectively. Just removing it might not be the way to go, but something different is needed.

Meta would *love* to see Section 230 removed or replaced with something that gives them untouchable market dominance. They can take their lumps and win because the government crushed their competition.

We know this because Mark Zuckerberg testified to Congress about it.

www.eff.org/deeplinks/20...

And repealing it will ensure that only companies with legal departments the size of small nations can survive, thereby cementing Meta's domination of the Internet.

Wikipedia needs Section 230. Why do you hate Wikipedia?

medium.com/wikimedia-po...
